It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, Microtea sprengelii is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
